bill.title: Firearms Possession; Misdemeanor Stalking and Sexual Assault
bill.description: Specifies that harassment by stalking and sexual assault are among the offenses that disqualify a person from owning, possessing, or controlling any firearm or ammunition. (SD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to JUD, referral sheet 2
Carried over to 2016 Regular Session.
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Thursday, 02-25-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org
The committee(s) on JUD recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until Tuesday, 03-01-16 at 2:00 PM in room 325.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Tuesday, 03-01-16 2:00PM in conference room 325.

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 12 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Takayama, Woodson, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; 1 Noes: Representative(s) McDermott; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Nakashima.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 723-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1; placed on the calendar for Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) McDermott voting no (1) and Representative(s) Kong, Saiki, Tupola excused (3).

Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Tokioka, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Choy, DeCoite, Har, Ito, Kong, McDermott, Oshiro, Tupola voting no (8) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 174).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDL.
The committee(s) on PSM has scheduled a public hearing on 03-15-16 1:20PM in conference room 229.
The committee(s) on PSM deferred the measure until 03-22-16 1:25PM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on PSM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in PSM were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) Nishihara, Espero, Baker, Inouye; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from PSM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3065) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to JDL.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 03-30-16 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Kim, L. Thielen; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) K.Kahele.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3490) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-12-16.

Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 22; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) K.Kahele, Kidani, Riviere, Wakai . Noes, 2 (Senator(s) Harimoto, Ihara). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Slom). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 501) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 609).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-14-16.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 635).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).

Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with Representative(s) McKelvey, Ward voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Choy, Creagan, DeCoite, Har, Ito, Kong, McDermott, Say, Tokioka, Tupola voting no (10) and Representative(s) Ing, Oshiro excused (2).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 658).
Transmitted to Governor.
